content:
I went to the mobilize sign up to get the link to invite my family and friends to the phonebanks I'm facilitating over the next week. I noticed the late night shift is listed as 10pm - 11:30pm EDT. Is that accurate? I assumed this would be a standard 2 hour shift. I'm going to be facilitating at that time, so want to be able to send out the right timeframe. I'm not sure if it can be corrected in mobilize. Thanks!

This is the link where I'm seeing this at: https://events.democrats.org/event/664004/
Hi Laura, yes! The campaign has opened up even more shifts for people to call!
Sorry, my question was about the shift length. Is it 90 minutes or 2 hours? The mobilize link shows only 90 minutes for that shift, whereas all the others are 2 hours.
Most of the shifts are two hours, but that includes training for beginners.
Oh, sorry! Yes I do believe it should still be 2 hours. They may have it cut off since it is technically the next day at 12:00am?

Yeah, that's what I was thinking as a possibility as well. Thanks for replying. I will assume it's 2 hours. I still wonder if they could edit it on mobilize so people generally would know what timeframe is expected when signing up. That's above my pay grade ($0) though.
I'll flag <@1284539093941878917> here. Sergio, would you mind clarifying the time-frame for the 10pm shift, will it be 2-hours like other shifts?
Yes--it should be 2 hours, but mobilize has a cut off time of 11:30pm for events
Perfect, thank you Frances! That's what I thought was happening.
